messages.subject: studying any subject vs. natural learning
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/03 5:51:49 PM, adonai@sirinet.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/03 5:51:49 PM, adonai@... writes:

<< I would have loved it if somebody had offered me the
chance to study any subject I'd wanted, who knows what I would have
become. I wasn't offered that opportunity, but my kids were.
>>

Do your children have the opportunity NOT to study any subjects?
Although they're not at Christian school now and not doing Abeka, you still
could move from where you are to really unschooling.

Here's something that might help.

http://sandradodd.com/deschooling

There are links at the bottom, and "disposable checklists" might help you be
more at peace with unschooling too.

<<I haven't even ASKED him to do anything as far as school, >>

Unschooling shouldn't have anything to do with school. It should be the
complete and total absence of school, schooling and schoolishness.

Sandra
